intro: Crocus marcetii, commonly known as the Val d'Aosta crocus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Italy. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh mountain environments. Its bulbs are relatively small and are often covered in a protective layer of fibrous material. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
